item.title: NLnet grant application
item.author: bitfl0wer
item.description:
NLnet grant application

The NLnet foundation is a non-profit organization that supports open-source projects. They have agrant program that funds projects that align with their goals. On behalf of Polyphony and thepolyproto project, I have submitted an application for a grant of 10,000€ from the NLnet foundationin their funding round of October 2024.

item.title: polyproto extensions
item.author: bitfl0wer
item.description:
polyproto extensions.

polyproto is a new federation protocol. Its main focus is enabling seamless participation of oneactor on many different servers. The core specification lacks routes for sending any sort of usergenerated data anywhere, though. What is up with that?

item.title: X.509 in polyproto
item.author: bitfl0wer
item.description:
Certificates, please: X.509 in polyproto

This blog post covers a bit about how and why X.509 is used in polyproto, and how we try to makethe process of implementing your own server and incorporating it into an existing network a littleeasier.

item.title: Account migration in polyproto
item.author: bitfl0wer
item.description: Account migration is an important and difficult thing to get right in federated systems. In this blogpost, I will outline how I imagine account migration to work in polyproto, and what benefits thisapproach brings.
